text:
For some reason, servlets-ssi.jar munges scandinavian characters when ssi
include directive is used.

We complained about this issue last fall, and got it fixed. In fact, I still
have the JAR from 20011113 nightly build, which works just fine.

I can not see difference in actual source returned by these two JARs, something
fishy with the response headers?

It seems to me that something leads Netscape/IE to choose a wrong font to
display the page - if you forcibly set character set, Netscape swithes font
displays fine (until you reload the page).
creator: maxxon@davisor.com

text:
Can you see if things work correctly with a recent nightly build, ie: HEAD?

If your ssi-servlet.jar does not contain classes like SsiDispatcher or 
SsiConditional then it is the old version of the SSI support.  There are 
numerous problems with this old version.  

I'm almost to the point where I think it should be removed from the 4.0 
releases or back-ported from HEAD to the 4.0.x branch.  The stuff that's 
released with the 4.0 series is too fragile for production use.

That being said, if it still doesn't work with a recent nightly build then I'll 
try to look into it.
